alert.note: Alert for Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 5:05AM EDT until August 30 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR WYOMING COUNTY... At 505 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain had ended in the area with just light showers remaining. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen, but runoff continues. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tunkhannock, Falls, Factoryville, Noxen, Mehoopany, Nicholson, Meshoppen, Forkston, Evans Falls, Osterhout, Beaumont, Lake Carey, Kasson Brook, Lovelton, Vernon, Eatonville, Vosburg, Russell Hill, Ruggles and Aldovin. Mehoopany Creek and Tunkhannock Creek received some of the heaviest rainfall and have begun to rise rapidly. These creeks are likely to reach near bankfull or flood in the next hour or two. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
